data.title: Gloria Stuart
data.meta_description: Find the location of Gloria Stuart's star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame, read a biography, see related stars and browse a map of important places in their career.
data.text:
Actress Born July 4, 1910 in Santa Monica, CA

A Hollywood star of the 1930s, Gloria Stuart returned to the screen half a century later to portray Rose, the elderly shipwreck survivor and counterpart to Kate Winsletâs character in the blockbuster 1997 movie âTitanic.â The actress, still striking, was 87 at the time.

Born in Santa Monica on July 14, 1910, Stuart graduated from Santa Monica High School in 1927. Small roles at the Pasadena Playhouse and elsewhere quickly led to a contract at Universal.

She appeared in numerous films in the '30s and '40s, including âThe Dark Old House,â âThe Invisible Man,â âRoman Scandals,â âGold Diggers of 1935â and two Shirley Temple vehicles, âRebecca of Sunnybrook Farmâ and âPoor Little Rich Girl.â

But the roles grew repetitive and Stuart left Hollywood, moving to New York with her husband, screenwriter Arthur Sheekman, to try her luck on Broadway. But the parts she hoped for didnât materialize and Stuart eventually left acting, becoming an accomplished painter and later, a book printer.

Stuart did not have an agent when she received a call from casting agent Mali Finn to ask if sheâd be interested in reading for a part in James Cameronâs âTitanic.â Her performance in the film, a fictional romance framed by Roseâs memories of the 1912 tragedy, would earn her a Screen Actors Guild Award and an Oscar nomination for best supporting actress.

A founding member of the Screen Actors Guild, Stuartâs close friends have included Groucho Marx, who was her husbandâs mentor; Dorothy Parker, with whom she founded the League to Aid Spanish Orphans during the Spanish civil war; Charlie Chaplin; Bette Davis; and Humphrey Bogart.
